SENT.plain: The familial occurrence of Behçet's disease in the 564 Behçet's patients treated in the Uveitis Survey Clinic of the Hokkaido University Hospital between 1967 and 1992 was investigated
Familial occurrence of Behçet's disease was found in 18 patients from 9 families
The male-to-female ratio was 3.5 in the familial cases, which was significantly higher than in the sporadic cases
Familial occurrence was most frequently seen among siblings
Most patients, including all female patients, had the complete type
They had typical ocular lesions, and exhibited bilateral uveoretinitis with poor visual prognosis, particularly the female patients
Frequency of HLA-B5 was 92% in the familial patients, which was much higher than in both the controls and the sporadic cases
It seems probable that patients with familial occurrence of this disease have a poorer prognosis with more susceptible immunogenetic backgrounds
